intro: Christensenia aesculifolia subsp. korthalsii, commonly known as the Korthalsii hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, pentagonal flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
